oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Andrew Jackson equestrian statue, Nashville, Tennessee, 1977 June
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of the Clark Mills equestrian bronze statue of General Andrew Jackson at the Battle of New Orleans. It is one of the three identical statues sculpted by the artist. This statue stands upon the front lawn to the Tennessee State Capitol Building in downtown Nashville. The high-rise office building pictured in the background is Parkway Towers, located at 404 James Robertson Parkway. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mills, Clark, 1810-1883; Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845--Statues
Parkway Towers (Nashville, Tenn.)
